abstract: Google has acquired Metaweb, a start-up that makes connections between people, places and things on the Web.
snippet: Google has acquired Metaweb, a start-up that makes connections between people, places and things on the Web.
lead_paragraph: There are some Web searches that Google doesn’t handle so well — like finding a famous person’s birthday, or searching for a word that means many different things. Search for “Boston,” for example, and all the top links are about the city in Massachusetts. But Boston is also the name of a band and 26 other cities.

headline.main: Google Buys Metaweb to Improve Search Results
